context.p: Security-enabled Linux (SELinux) is security feature for Linux that lets you to set access control through policies. Eucalyptus is not compatible with SELinux.
context.note: If you are installing on Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, you can skip this section.
context.p: To configure SELinux to allow Eucalyptus access:

step.cmd: Open /etc/selinux/config and edit the line SELINUX=enforcing to SELINUX=permissive.
